intro: Asyneuma amplexicaule, commonly known as the clasping asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that wrap around the stem, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Asyneuma amplexicaule is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
